name: Silver Arowana
description: The Silver Arowana, scientifically known as Osteoglossum bicirrhosum, is a majestic fish known for its sleek silver body and distinctive elongated shape. It is a popular choice among aquarium enthusiasts.

name: Black Arowana
description: The Black Arowana, also known as the Black Dragonfish, is a rare and captivating species prized for its deep black coloration. It is a unique and sought-after addition to advanced aquariums.

name: Jardini Arowana
description: The Jardini Arowana, scientifically known as Scleropages jardini, is a stunning and lively species appreciated for its unique color patterns and active behavior. It is a captivating choice for experienced aquarists.

name: African Arowana
description: The African Arowana, scientifically known as Heterotis niloticus, is a unique freshwater fish native to Africa. It is recognized for its distinctive appearance and is well-suited for large aquariums.

name: Cherry Barb
description: The Cherry Barb, scientifically known as Puntius titteya, is a popular and vibrant freshwater fish species. It is named for its bright red coloration, resembling a cherry.

name: Tiger Barb
description: The Tiger Barb, scientifically known as Puntigrus tetrazona, is a lively and colorful freshwater fish species. It is named for its striped pattern resembling a tiger.

name: Gold Barb
description: The Gold Barb, scientifically known as Puntius semifasciolatus, is a peaceful and attractive freshwater fish species. It is prized for its golden-yellow coloration.

name: Tinfoil Barb
description: The Tinfoil Barb, scientifically known as Barbonymus schwanenfeldii, is a large and active freshwater fish species. It is named for its shiny silver coloration resembling tinfoil.

name: Rosy Barb
description: The Rosy Barb, scientifically known as Pethia conchonius, is a peaceful and colorful freshwater fish species. It is named for its rosy-pink coloration.

name: Snakeskin Barb
description: The Snakeskin Barb, scientifically known as Pethia ticto, is a peaceful and striking freshwater fish species. It is named for its intricate pattern resembling snakeskin.

name: Denison Barb
description: The Denison Barb, scientifically known as Sahyadria denisonii, is an active and colorful freshwater fish species. It is named after an aquarium fish exporter in the 1990s.

name: Odessa Barb
description: The Odessa Barb, scientifically known as Pethia padamya, is a vibrant and active freshwater fish species. It is named after the city of Odessa in Ukraine and is prized for its attractive coloration.

name: Black Ruby Barb
description: The Black Ruby Barb, scientifically known as Pethia nigrofasciata, is a striking freshwater fish species characterized by its deep black and red coloration. It is a peaceful and active fish that adds visual appeal to community aquariums.

name: Checker Barb
description: The Checker Barb, scientifically known as Oliotius oligolepis, is a peaceful and attractive freshwater fish species. It is named for the distinctive checkerboard-like pattern on its body, which adds visual interest to aquarium setups.

name: Spanner Barb
description: The Spanner Barb, scientifically known as Barbus lateristriga, is a lively and social freshwater fish species. It is characterized by its distinctive markings and makes a delightful addition to community aquariums.

name: Filament Barb
description: The Filament Barb, scientifically known as Dawkinsia filamentosus, is an active and attractive freshwater fish species. It is named for the filament-like extensions on its fins and is known for its schooling behavior.

name: Golden Dwarf Barb

name: Three Spot Barb

name: Five Banded Barb

name: Filament Barb

name: Blue Gourami
description: The Blue Gourami (Trichogaster trichopterus), also known as the Three-spot Gourami, is a popular freshwater fish species native to Southeast Asia. It is named for its striking blue coloration, which varies depending on its mood and environment. Blue Gouramis are labyrinth fish, meaning they can breathe atmospheric air, allowing them to survive in poorly oxygenated waters. They are generally peaceful and can be kept in community aquariums with other non-aggressive fish species. Blue Gouramis are omnivores and will readily accept a varied diet consisting of flakes, pellets, and live or frozen foods.

name: Gold Gourami
description: The Gold Gourami (Trichogaster trichopterus var. 'Gold'), a color variation of the Three-spot Gourami, is prized for its bright, metallic gold coloration. Like its blue counterpart, the Gold Gourami is a labyrinth fish with the ability to breathe air. It exhibits a peaceful temperament, making it suitable for community aquariums. Gold Gouramis are omnivores and will consume a variety of foods, including flakes, pellets, and live or frozen foods. They thrive in well-planted aquariums with plenty of hiding spots and open swimming areas.

name: Honey Dwarf Gourami
description: The Honey Dwarf Gourami (Trichogaster chuna), also known as the Sunset Gourami, is a small and peaceful freshwater fish species native to South Asia. It is named for its honey-like coloration, with shades of gold and orange. The Honey Dwarf Gourami is an ideal choice for smaller aquarium setups due to its manageable size and peaceful temperament. It is a labyrinth fish, capable of breathing atmospheric air, and appreciates densely planted aquariums with subdued lighting. This gourami species is omnivorous, feeding on both plant matter and small insects or crustaceans.

name: Pearl Gourami
description: The Pearl Gourami (Trichopodus leerii) is a graceful and attractive freshwater fish species native to Southeast Asia. It is known for its pearlescent scales and distinctive black markings on its body. The Pearl Gourami is a peaceful fish, making it an excellent choice for community aquariums with other peaceful species. It prefers densely planted aquariums with plenty of hiding spots and floating vegetation. This gourami species is omnivorous, feeding on a varied diet that includes flakes, pellets, live, and frozen foods. It is relatively hardy and can adapt to a wide range of water conditions.

name: Sparkling Gourami
description: The Sparkling Gourami (Trichopsis pumila) is a charming and diminutive freshwater fish species native to Southeast Asia. It is named for the iridescent, sparkly appearance of its scales. Sparkling Gouramis are peaceful and can be kept in small groups or community aquariums. They prefer heavily planted tanks with gentle water flow and subdued lighting. This gourami species is labyrinth fish and can gulp air from the water's surface. Sparkling Gouramis are omnivores, consuming small insects, algae, and commercial fish foods.

name: Kissing Gourami
description: The Kissing Gourami (Helostoma temminckii) is a fascinating freshwater fish species known for its peculiar mouth structure, which resembles puckered lips. It is native to Southeast Asia and is popular among aquarium hobbyists for its distinctive appearance. Kissing Gouramis are generally peaceful but can exhibit territorial behavior, especially during breeding. They require ample space and a well-planted aquarium with hiding spots. Kissing Gouramis are omnivorous and will readily consume a variety of foods, including flakes, pellets, and live or frozen foods.

name: Blue Paradise
description: The Blue Paradise Gourami (Trichogaster lalius) is a vibrant and colorful freshwater fish species native to Southeast Asia. It is named for its striking blue coloration and is sometimes referred to as the Dwarf Gourami. Blue Paradise Gouramis are peaceful and can be kept in community aquariums with other non-aggressive fish species. They prefer densely planted tanks with plenty of hiding spots and subdued lighting. This gourami species is omnivorous, feeding on a varied diet that includes flakes, pellets, live, and frozen foods.

name: Opaline Gourami
description: The Opaline Gourami (Trichopodus trichopterus var. 'Opaline') is a beautiful freshwater fish species that exhibits a pearlescent sheen over its scales. It is a color variation of the Three-spot Gourami and is named for its opalescent appearance. Opaline Gouramis are peaceful and can coexist with a variety of tankmates in community aquariums. They prefer heavily planted tanks with gentle water flow and subdued lighting. This gourami species is omnivorous, feeding on a diet of flakes, pellets, and live or frozen foods.

name: Powder Blue Gourami
description: The Powder Blue Gourami (Trichogaster lalius var. 'Powder Blue') is a captivating freshwater fish species with a distinct powder blue coloration. It is a color variation of the Dwarf Gourami and is prized for its beauty. Powder Blue Gouramis are peaceful and can be kept in community aquariums with other non-aggressive fish species. They prefer densely planted tanks with plenty of hiding spots and subdued lighting. This gourami species is omnivorous, feeding on a varied diet that includes flakes, pellets, live, and frozen foods.

name: Flame Dwarf Gourami
description: The Flame Dwarf Gourami (Trichogaster lalius var. 'Flame') is a vibrant freshwater fish species with fiery red and orange coloration. It is a color variation of the Dwarf Gourami and is prized for its striking appearance. Flame Dwarf Gouramis are peaceful and can be kept in community aquariums with other non-aggressive fish species. They prefer densely planted tanks with plenty of hiding spots and subdued lighting. This gourami species is omnivorous, feeding on a varied diet that includes flakes, pellets, live, and frozen foods.

name: Giant Gourami
description: The Giant Gourami, scientifically known as Osphronemus goramy, is one of the largest freshwater fish species in the gourami family. Native to Southeast Asia, it is named for its impressive size and robust appearance. Giant Gouramis are known for their aggresive temperament, making them suitable for solo or large community aquariums with other sizeable fish species. They require spacious tanks with plenty of hiding spots and vegetation. While juveniles may exhibit some territorial behavior, adults are generally docile. Like other gouramis, they possess labyrinth organs, enabling them to breathe atmospheric air.

name: Golden Dwarf Barb
description: The Golden Dwarf Barb, scientifically known as Pethia gelius, is a small and peaceful freshwater fish species. It is prized for its golden coloration and is suitable for smaller aquarium setups.

name: Three Spot Barb
description: The Three Spot Barb, scientifically known as Puntius trifasciatus, is a peaceful and hardy freshwater fish species. It is named for the prominent black spots on its body and is suitable for community aquariums.

name: Five Banded Barb
description: The Five Banded Barb, scientifically known as Puntius pentazona, is a colorful and peaceful freshwater fish species. It is named for the five horizontal bands on its body and is popular among aquarium hobbyists.

name: Bala Shark
description: The Bala Shark, scientifically known as Balantiocheilos melanopterus, is a sleek and active freshwater fish species native to Southeast Asia. It features a silver body with black margins on its fins, resembling a miniature shark. Although often mistaken for a shark, it is a peaceful schooling fish suitable for larger community aquariums.

name: Redtail Shark
description: The Redtail Shark, scientifically known as Epalzeorhynchos bicolor, is a striking freshwater fish species with a vibrant red tail fin contrasting against its black body. It is territorial and may exhibit aggression towards similar-looking species, making it suitable for semi-aggressive community tanks.

name: Siamese Algae Eater
description: The Siamese Algae Eater, scientifically known as Crossocheilus siamensis, is a popular freshwater fish species valued for its algae-eating habits. It has a slender, elongated body with a distinctive black stripe running from its head to tail. This peaceful and hardy fish is an excellent addition to community aquariums for controlling algae growth.

name: Rainbow Shark
description: The Rainbow Shark, scientifically known as Epalzeorhynchos frenatum, is a colorful and territorial freshwater fish species. It exhibits a striking red or orange coloration on its fins and a dark body. Despite its name, it is not a true shark but belongs to the Cyprinidae family. Due to its territorial nature, it should be kept in larger aquariums with ample hiding spots.

name: Six Banded Barb
description: The Six Banded Barb, scientifically known as Puntius hexazona, is a peaceful and attractive freshwater fish species. It is named for the six horizontal bands on its body and is suitable for community aquariums.

name: Neon Tetra
description: Neon Tetras are among the most popular tetras due to their striking iridescent blue and red colors.

name: Cardinal Tetra
description: Cardinal Tetras are known for their vibrant red and blue colors, similar to Neon Tetras.

name: Ember Tetra
description: Ember Tetras have a beautiful fiery orange coloration that adds warmth to any aquarium.

name: Black Neon Tetra
description: Black Neon Tetras feature a combination of black and silver colors, creating a striking appearance.

name: Vampire Tetra
description: Vampire Tetras are known for their iconic sharp teeth and predatory behavior, requiring a larger tank.

name: Congo Tetra
description: Congo Tetras are large, peaceful tetras known for their distinctive coloration and fin extensions.

name: Bleeding Heart Tetra
description: Bleeding Heart Tetras are named for the heart-shaped red marking on their silver bodies.

name: Black Skirt Tetra
description: Black Skirt Tetras are known for their distinctive black markings on their fins and bodies.

name: Serpae Tetra
description: Serpae Tetras are known for their vibrant red coloration and schooling behavior.

name: Bloodfin Tetra
description: Bloodfin Tetras are known for their distinctive red fins, adding a splash of color to aquariums.

name: Emperor Tetra

name: Von Rio Tetra

description: The Common Black Molly is a popular freshwater fish known for its sleek black coloration.

name: Dalmatian Molly

name: Lyretail Molly
description: Lyretail Mollies are known for their distinct lyre-shaped tails, adding elegance to aquariums.

name: Sailfin Molly

name: Gold Dust Molly

description: The Yellow Swordtail is a brightly colored fish with a distinct sword-like tail, adding vibrancy to aquariums.

name: Veiltail Goldfish
description: The Veiltail Goldfish is known for its long, flowing double tail that gives it an elegant appearance.

name: Common Goldfish
description: The Common Goldfish is the classic goldfish variety with a sleek, streamlined body and vibrant coloration.

name: Tamasaba Goldfish
description: The Tamasaba Goldfish is recognized for its elongated body and distinct forked tail, resembling a traditional Japanese fan.

name: Bubble Eye Goldfish
description: The Bubble Eye Goldfish is characterized by its fluid-filled sacs or bubbles underneath its eyes, creating a distinctive appearance.

name: Telescope Goldfish
description: The Telescope Goldfish is known for its protruding, telescope-like eyes, giving it a distinctive and charming appearance.

name: Oranda Goldfish
description: The Oranda Goldfish is distinguished by the prominent hood or wen on its head, which can develop into a large, fleshy growth.

name: Comet Goldfish
description: The Comet Goldfish is characterized by its long, flowing tail fin and vibrant coloration, resembling a comet streaking through the sky.

name: Lionhead Goldfish
description: The Lionhead Goldfish is known for its lack of a dorsal fin and the development of a raspberry-like growth on the top of its head.

name: Ryukin Goldfish
description: The Ryukin Goldfish has a distinctive hump on its back, a pointed caudal fin, and a deep body, making it a visually striking variety.

name: Shubunkin Goldfish
description: The Shubunkin Goldfish is known for its calico coloration, which includes patches of red, orange, blue, and black, creating a vibrant and unique appearance.

name: Celestial Eye Goldfish
description: The Celestial Eye Goldfish has eyes that are pointed upwards, giving it a unique and celestial appearance.

name: Ranchu Goldfish
description: The Ranchu Goldfish is known for its rounded body, lack of a dorsal fin, and a distinctive head shape, creating a charming and unique appearance.

name: Wakin Goldfish
description: The Wakin Goldfish is known for its long, double tail and vibrant coloration, combining characteristics of the common goldfish and the fantail.

name: Fantail Goldfish
description: The Fantail Goldfish is characterized by its double tail and rounded body, creating an elegant and graceful appearance.

name: Butterfly Tail Goldfish
description: The Butterfly Tail Goldfish has telescope eyes and a butterfly-like tail, creating a unique and graceful swimming appearance.

name: Tosakin Goldfish
description: The Tosakin Goldfish is recognized for its unique tail structure, which spreads out horizontally like a fan, creating a distinctive appearance.

name: Pearlscale Goldfish
description: The Pearlscale Goldfish is known for its round body and scales that resemble pearls, giving it a unique and decorative appearance.

name: Gold Nugget Pleco
description: The Gold Nugget Pleco, scientifically known as Baryancistrus xanthellus, is admired for its vibrant golden-yellow coloration and unique patterns. It adds a touch of elegance to freshwater aquariums.

name: Zebra Pleco
description: The Zebra Pleco, scientifically known as Hypancistrus zebra, is highly prized for its striking black and white zebra-like stripes. It is a captivating and sought-after species among aquarium enthusiasts.

name: Bristlenose Pleco
description: The Bristlenose Pleco, also known as Ancistrus, is characterized by its distinctive bristle-like appendages on its snout. It is a popular and beneficial addition to aquariums.

name: Common Pleco
description: The Common Pleco, or Hypostomus plecostomus, is a widely recognized and often large catfish species. It is known for its ability to help control algae in aquariums.
maxGrowthSize: Up to 24 inches (60 cm) or more

name: Sailfin Pleco
description: The Sailfin Pleco, scientifically known as Pterygoplichthys gibbiceps, is named for its large sail-like dorsal fin. It is a robust and adaptable species with distinctive markings.

name: Royal Pleco
description: The Royal Pleco, or Panaque nigrolineatus, is known for its striking appearance, featuring a black body with white or yellowish spots. It is a captivating and sought-after species.

name: Snowball Pleco
description: The Snowball Pleco, scientifically known as Hypancistrus inspector, is prized for its unique appearance with a white or light-colored body covered in small dark spots.

name: Rubber Lip Pleco
description: The Rubber Lip Pleco, or Chaetostoma milesi, is known for its rubbery lips and its ability to consume algae. It is a smaller and peaceful pleco species suitable for community tanks.

name: Leopard Frog Pleco
description: The Leopard Frog Pleco, scientifically known as Peckoltia compta, features a distinctive spotted pattern resembling a leopard. It is a smaller and attractive pleco species.

name: Peppermint Pleco
description: The Peppermint Pleco, or Parancistrus nudiventris, is known for its attractive peppermint-like coloration, with alternating light and dark bands. It is a visually appealing species.

name: Vampire Pleco
description: The Vampire Pleco, scientifically known as Leporacanthicus heterodon, is named for its fang-like teeth. It is a unique and captivating pleco species, particularly appreciated by enthusiasts.

name: Sunshine Pleco
description: The Sunshine Pleco, or Scobinancistrus aureatus, is known for its vibrant yellow-gold coloration. It is a striking and sought-after pleco species, adding a splash of color to aquariums.

name: Blue-Eyed Pleco
description: The Blue-Eyed Pleco, scientifically known as Panaqolus albivermis, features distinctive blue eyes and an attractive spotted pattern on its body. It is a visually appealing pleco species.

name: Blue/Green Phantom Pleco
description: The Blue or Green Phantom Pleco, scientifically known as Hemiancistrus sp. L128, is admired for its stunning blue or green coloration and distinctive markings. It is a captivating and sought-after species.

name: Longnose Gar
description: The Longnose Gar, scientifically known as Lepisosteus osseus, is a slender and elongated freshwater fish with a distinctive long snout. It is known for its hardiness and adaptability to various aquarium conditions.

name: Spotted Gar
description: The Spotted Gar, scientifically known as Lepisosteus oculatus, is a visually striking freshwater fish with dark spots on its body. It is known for its unique appearance and adaptability to aquarium life.

name: Shortnose Gar
description: The Shortnose Gar, scientifically known as Lepisosteus platostomus, is a smaller species with a short, broad snout. It is recognized for its aggressive feeding behavior and adaptability to aquarium conditions.

name: Florida Gar
description: The Florida Gar, scientifically known as Lepisosteus platyrhincus, is a smaller gar species with a slender body and attractive greenish coloration. It is suitable for aquariums and adapts well to captivity.

name: Tropical Gar
description: The Tropical Gar, belonging to the genus Atractosteus, is known for its tropical habitat and distinctive appearance. It is a fascinating species suitable for larger aquariums with appropriate conditions.

name: Alligator Gar
description: The Alligator Gar, scientifically known as Atractosteus spatula, is one of the largest freshwater fish known for its alligator-like appearance. It requires a spacious aquarium due to its size and predatory nature.

name: Cuban Gar
description: The Cuban Gar, scientifically known as Atractosteus tristoechus, is a tropical gar species found in Cuba. It is recognized for its unique appearance and is suitable for larger aquariums with appropriate conditions.

name: Giant Danio
description: The Giant Danio, scientifically known as Devario aequipinnatus, is a popular freshwater fish species known for its vibrant colors and active nature. It is a schooling fish that requires a spacious aquarium with plenty of swimming space.
